intro: Oenanthe cyclocarpa, commonly known as the cyclocarpa water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in wet or marshy habitats and is often found near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
